column4: guys how can i access my windows files from ubuntu?, i have a windows os on partition 1, and partition 2 for my movies etc. i now installed ubuntu on partition 2 but i can't seem to find my files in that partition. i can see my files on partition 1 where windows is installed but not on partition 2
yes2
did you delete the partition when you installed ubuntu?
you have at least 3 if you include swap
do you see it in places?
i only see part1, no part2 shown but when i open my computer, part2 is shown as file system
so you see it in "computer"?
can you pastebin the output of "sudo /sbin/fdisk -l"
yes2 i see them both
you cant open it from "computer" then?
here it is, thanks.
no problem, glad i could help :)
here XD http://paste.ubuntu.com/535745/
most likely it just isnt auto-mounted, so once you open it, you will have an icon on your desktop for it
you can view it now though right?
how can i automount it? tnx
good instructions on this page:       http://www.psychocats.net/ubuntu/mountlinux
ok2 i'll read it, so for now can i open it without mounting it first?
when you open it it is mounted
tnx for the help
no problem, for automounting that page should straighten you out :)
wow i've done it thank you very much, tnx tnx have a gud day
good to hear :)
